byline.contributor: Sadi Niyungeko contributed reporting from Bujumbura, Burundi.

abstract: Burundi army general says military has removed Pres Pierre Nkurunziza from power, but it is not clear whether a successful coup has taken place; news sends protesters, who have been trying for more than two weeks to block Nkurunziza's bid for another term, into streets in celebration.
lead_paragraph: The army general announced Wednesday on a private radio station that the military had ousted the leader amid protests in Burundi.

headline.main: Burundi General Claims to Oust President Pierre Nkurunziza
headline.print_headline: President Has Been Removed From Power, General Says

snippet: The army general announced Wednesday on a private radio station that the military had ousted the leader amid protests in Burundi.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
